meanings.definition: The action or process of making something stronger or more solid.
meanings.sent1: The consolidation of the bricks with cement made the wall sturdy.
meanings.sent2: After the consolidation of the ingredients, the cake was ready to be baked.
meanings.sent3: The consolidation of the jello in the fridge turned it into a wobbly treat.
meanings.sent4: The consolidation of the team's efforts resulted in a successful project.
meanings.sent5: The consolidation of the puzzle pieces created a complete picture.

meanings.definition: The act of combining separate things into a single, unified whole.
meanings.sent1: The consolidation of the colors in the painting made it more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: The consolidation of the departments improved the company's efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The consolidation of the socks in the drawer made it easier to find a pair.
meanings.sent4: The consolidation of the melodies in the song created a harmonious tune.
meanings.sent5: The consolidation of the scattered papers on the desk cleared up the workspace.
